thread.title: Visitors gyrate to Bollywood numbers

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Visitors gyrate to Bollywood numbers
text:
Our Correspondent
Kullu, October 25
Bollywood singer Kshitij Tare entertained the audience on the third cultural evening of the Kullu Dasehra fest. Visitors were seen dancing to the tune of songs doled out by Tare. The cultural troupe from Indonesia and Bali Islands also gave a performance. The dance performance by artistes from Bhuttico was appreciated by one and all. Artistes from Solan too performed. Lamas from Kee Monastery, Spiti, presented ‘Chham’. Earlier, Health and Revenue Minister Kaul Singh was presented the traditional Kullu cap, a shawl and Dasehra souvenir by chairman of the Kullu Dusshera Festival Committee and Ayurveda and Cooperative Minister Karan Singh. Rakesh Kanwar, Deputy Commissioner, and vice-chairman, Kullu Dasehra Festival Committee, thanked the chief guest and other dignitaries. A large number of people gathered at the Kala Kendra to witness the spectacular performances by international and national artists. Foreign and domestic tourists, besides large number of local residents, were present. Kullu Superintendent of Police Padam Chand, Additional District Magistrate Vinay Singh and other officials were also present. Kullu Dasehra sports festival ends The Dasehra Sports Festival-2015 function concluded at the Rath ground in Dhalpur here today. The Deputy Commissioner (DC) was the chief guest on the closing ceremony. During his address, the DC appealed to the youth for refraining from taking drugs. He lauded the efforts of the Dasehra Sports Festival Committee in promoting sports and other activities to keep the youth far from the clutches of drugs. Earlier, Superintendent of Police Padam Chand, who is also the Chairman of the Dasehra Sports Festival committee, welcomed the chief guest and outlined the sports activities carried out during the event. Later, the Deputy Commissioner presented awards to the winning teams of various events.
